newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia ACF plans rights, bond issues.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia ACF plans rights, bond issues.

text.p: Malaysian financial services firm ACF Holdings Bhd said it was proposing a one-for-five rights issue at 2.50 ringgit a share.
It also proposed an issue of 220 million ringgit in unsecured bank guaranteed bonds with 73.8 million warrants, a company statement received on Tuesday said.
ACF, a unit of diversified Lion Corp Bhd, said the rights and bond issues would raise gross proceeds of 312.3 million ringgit.

Of this, 302 million ringgit will be used to subscribe to the non-renounceable rights issue and irredeemable convertible preference shares (ICPS) of its subsidiary finance house, Asia Commercial Finance Bhd.
The subscription to Asia Commercial's rights and ICPS issues will strengthen its unit's capital base and help it meet the capital requirement of a Tier-1 finance company.

A Tier-1 finance house -- which must have minimum shareholders' funds of 300 million ringgit -- are allowed a more liberal operating environment, including remittance services within Malaysia and granting unsecured business loans of up to 500,000 ringgit.
The proposals are subject to approval by regulatory authorities and ACF shareholders.
